This is such a philosophical manga. It displays the beauty of innocence and the bloom of curiosity. The teacher represents all of us, who once had dreams and aspirations, but adult life wrecked us like a freight train and all it is left are dreams of what could have been. He sees the best of his years gone and the child who lives inside him trapped in a society that does not comprehend him.

However, the children represent freedom, innocence, and ingenuity. They help the sensei rediscover his youth and come in peace with his innermost self. In the end, he accepts there's still hope and embraces his life once again.
This is the gift from heaven
God created us as talented beings. He gave us the ability to create masterful pieces of art. Artists like these are one of the ways in which God shows us the beauty and truth of the world.
I have accepted that I am a degenerate and I accept that this doujin is a piece of art
